thread.section_title: Arsenal to blame for Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil contract farce, says Martin Keown – Metro
thread.title: Arsenal to blame for Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil contract farce, says Martin Keown
thread.title_full: Arsenal to blame for Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil contract farce, says Martin Keown

author: markbrus88
title: Arsenal to blame for Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil contract farce, says Martin Keown
text:
Arsene Wenger faces losing two star players (Picture: Getty) Arsenal legend Martin Keown admits he is surprised to see the club allow themselves to get into the situation they have done with Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil .
Jose Mourinho report card: Special One's biggest challenge still on course for success The former Gunners defender is baffled by his old club’s incompetence in handling the contracts of their two star players, saying such a situation is ‘unprecedented’.
Both attackers have been vital to Arsenal’s best moments this season, with Sanchez in particular at the top of his game with 22 goals in all competitions.
Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil are the biggest names at Arsenal (Picture: Getty) However, the Chilean and the German have just over a year to run on their current deals, and are no closer to renewing as Arsenal face the increasing possibility of losing them in cut-price moves this summer.
Arsenal fixtures Manchester City (H) – Sun 2 Apr
West Ham (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Crystal Palace (A) – Mon 10 Apr
Middlesbrough (A) – Mon 17 apr
Manchester City (N) FA Cup – Sun 23 Apr

Stoke (A) – Sat 13 May
More: Football Watch: Seamus Coleman suffers horrific leg break in Republic of Ireland v Wales 
True Blue! Watch Chelsea target's brilliant response to being told to join Arsenal 
It's done: £70m Chelsea target reveals he's decided his future 
‘Arsenal have lost four of the last five Premier League games and it is looking like hard work,’ Keown told the Daily Mail.
‘You need to be a band of brothers who want to stick together but it must be draining when you have two players who do not appear to want to be a part of it.
‘It seems unprecedented that the contracts of two star players are running out at the same time. That situation should not have been allowed to develop.’
MORE: Chelsea target Kalidou Koulibaly doesn’t appear keen on Arsenal move – video
